name: 量化方法與Ｒ語言實作
description: This course provides an overview of statistical models in linguistics and hands-on programming with R. No background in statistics or prior knowledge of R is assumed. The course begins with an overview of descriptive and inferential statistics. The statistical program R will be used throughout the course. By the end of the course, students should have a thorough knowledge of many statistical models used in modern linguistics and an ability to perform statistical analyses with R.
goals: Gain the fundamental concepts in statistics
Demonstrate the ability to conduct statistical analyses with R
syllabus:
This course provides an overview of statistical models in linguistics and hands-on programming with R. No background in statistics or prior knowledge of R is assumed. The course begins with an overview of descriptive and inferential statistics. The statistical program R will be used throughout the course. By the end of the course, students should have a thorough knowledge of many statistical models used in modern linguistics and an ability to perform statistical analyses with R. 

Week 1: Course Overview—R and RStudio

Week 2: Basic Data Manipulation and Graphical Displays in R

Week 3: Descriptive Statistics I—Probability Theory, Measures of Central Tendency

Week 4: Descriptive Statistics II—Measures of Dispersion, Standardization (z-test)

Week 5: Analysis of Variance I

Week 6: Analysis of Variance II

Week 7: (Multiple) Linear Regression

Week 8: Logistic Regression and Generalized Linear Models

Week 9: Review

Week 10: Midterm Exam

Week 11: Linear Mixed Effects Models

Week 12: Additive Models

Week 13: Decision Trees

Week 14: Classification

Week 15: Principal Component Analysis

Week 16: Clustering

Week 17: Review

Week 18: Final Exam
